nodes.bodyText:
I would rephrase the section a little with the same information. One option:
Services can define custom configurations in the ‘custom’ field. Custom configurations are passed to services through IPC. Service can listen on config changes via IPC and apply the new configuration without being forced to restart by Kernel. Details of how configuration change push/listening can be supported is documented in Configuration IPC Application and Dynamically reload config without restarting Evergreen service

Note: Currently custom configuration only support one level key-value. Detailed discussion is at Custom config supporting complex data structure

+system:

+
+### Config Validation
+
+root keys have to be recognized keys. Each component has its own validation logic.
+
+## Service Config Components
+
+### Lifecycle
+
+‘Services’ field contains all services config. Services including custom services and pluggable evergreen components.  
+
+```
+services: 
+<serviceName>:
+  lifecycle:
+    install:
+      skipif: onpath <executable>|exists <file>
+      script:
+      timeout: # default to be infinity. Number of seconds to timeout.
+      environment (currently setenv): # optional
+      
+    startup: # mutually exclusive from 'run'
+      script: # eg: brew services start influxdb
+      timeout: # Optional
+      environment:  # optional
+        <key>: overrideValue
+        
+    run: # mutually exclusive from 'startup'
+      script:
+      environment:
+      timeout: # Optional
+      periodicity: #Perodically run the command
+      
+    shutdown: # can co-exist with both startup/run
+      script:
+      environment: #optional
+      timeout: # Optional
+    
+    environment: # apply to all commands
